overview: So-June joined .406 as Chief Financial Officer in January 2006. Prior to .406, she was Chief Financial Officer of the venture capital firm Arcadia Partners from 2003 to 2006. From 1995 to 2000, So-June was a Senior Deal Specialist in PECO Energyâ€™s PowerTeam, one of the largest bulk energy trading groups in the US, where she was responsible for all asset valuations for acquisitions done by PECO. From 1992 to 1993, she was an associate to the Chairman at the Sunkyong Group, the third largest conglomerate in Korea operating over 20 subsidiaries. So-June holds an MBA from Dartmouthâ€™s Amos Tuck School of Business Administration and a BA in English Literature from Ewha Womanâ€™s University in Seoul, Korea.
